[NX]Dualism  [developer] Posted: Mar 23 @ 7:46am
Dear Players,

XIGNCODE3 is an well known anti-cheat tool that is currently being used by more than 2000 games.
It is very similar in its functionality to the ones used by Valve (VAC) or Blizzard (Warden) to protect their community from cheaters.

Client-side anti-cheat tools are considered to be much safer than server-side ones and they all have to scan information on your PC to protect the game from cheaters.
These programs are hashing scanned strings and comparing them to those of known malicious programs. No actual information about your system is ever sent or saved.

Please note that anti-cheat tools are a necessity in multiplayer games to protect you, our community, and please be assured that your privacy is important to us too.

Regards,
[NX]Dualism

reviewText:
Nexon: Hey guys! You like counter-strike right? You liked the Zombie Mod for it, too? Great! We'll just tack on our p2w attitude, a bit of censorship, and terribly translated lines! We'll even stick our name on the title so you know who to ha-- I mean love!
Me: WTF is this garbage? -420/50

*** EDIT ***

I am well aware I have over 150 hours on record (blame other games being on patch day).
My stance on the game has still not changed, but I'm in a much calmer place, at the time being, so I'll try giving it a less... ragey... review.

-MINUSES-
-The game is still very much p2w, as the best guns in the game are invariably purchasable for real money, or obtainable through the Death Star Torpedo shot that is the Decoder.

-The censorship is still there, and is just as noticable to those that can understand what they're saying, which I will get to later. The chat is annoyingly filled with astrixes, even for stupid phrases that only an over-protective mum or Chinese game would want or need.

-You still can't have a PROPER server, nor go to ANY server that isn't (in the scheme of things) run by Nexon. Seriously, I challenge you to find a PLAYER OR COMMUNITY HOSTED server. This has led to it being as though you were playing with bots, even with a full room.

-You cannot change your name without forking over a few bucks, you know, as if this were some sort of MMO. This also applies to clan tags (or tites, as they've been turned into).

-You will find the same exact 3-5 maps being repeated over, and over, and over.

-There's no way to filter languarges. This is especially problematic if you don't fluently speak Spanish in the American regional servers.

-Different player models have different stats, AGAIN giving an advantage to those wiling to fork money over (or who win the lottery-level luck of the Decoder).

-The twice-afore-mentioned Decoder CONSTANTLY plays the 'so-and-so player you have probobly no damned clue who is has just won <INSERT OVERPOWERED WEAPON / PLAYER MODEL HERE> message, which constantly interrupts the few times when someone manages to /actually/ start up a dialogue.

+PLUSSES+

+It's good to fill in the nostalgia, for a few hours.

+It provides the oppertunity to therapeutically punch zombies.

+It's a good time waster, when everything else you play is patching.

=That... really is all I can think about. Sorry guys. In the end, I wouldn't recommend this game, and I'm sorry about the saltiness in the O.P.

reviewText:
How to not make a video game:

-Make one team super OP
-Use a 17 year old game engine
-Add microtransactions
-Add crafting (as opposed to actually getting a weapon)
-Make craftable weapons only last a few days
-Make everything overpriced
-Put in tons of camping locations
-Re-use content from a 10 year old game
-Your zombie is an octagon (I wish I was joking)
-Pretend it's a horror game
-Foggify old maps to pretend they are new
-Make a crappy sound play every time someone dies
-Use an over-saturated game idea
-License a completely unrelated series
-Put your company name in the title
-Make it 2GB, because that's the size a game from 17 years ago is supposed to be, right?
-Make the menus incredibly hard to understand
-Make it free to play

And have fun, your crappy game is complete.

reviewText:
Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies is dissapointing.

PROS:
- Updated Graphics
- More guns
- Survival Mode

CONS:
- Unbalanced Zombie mode
- Pay 2 win
- Time consuming

OVERVIEW:
CSN: Zombies just doesn't live up. I can't tell if this game is trying to be a Call of Duty rip-off or not. Dead serious. In CSNZ, you can partake in multiple gamemodes that you feel you want to play. There's Original, which is basic CS 1.6. There's different kinds of Zombie modes, but I only played one. I had a huge problem with this Zombie mode. It is WAY too unbalanced. A CT has 100 HP, and can be turned into a Zombie in 1 hit. A Zombie has 2000 HP (with the exception of the 7000 HP host zombie) and can take a LONG time to kill. This game is a grindfest. I only won 2 rounds as Humans due to hiding. The last mode I want to talk about is Survival. This game should have never been called Zombies. It should've been about this Survival mode, because it is the best thing in this game and the only reason i'd go back to play (besides playing with new guns in Original mode). In Survival mode, it's purely you and your teammates and whatever cash you can scavenge. Waves of different kinds of HUMAN enemies will try to kill you. Regular gunmen, big ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• armored soldiers with miniguns, Survival has it all, including a Boss battle at the end of each one. As you kill more and more soldiers you can buy bigger and better guns and equipment. Survival missions technically have a story line, but you will be more inveloped in the gameplay than someone who only gives lines during the middles of waves. It can become really chaotic and what balances this factor out is a super quick regeneration system. It's just like CoD. Hide back and wait, but it only takes a couple of seconds. Normally, this kind of thing doesn't go good in my book. I've always thought regenerating health as a character was kind of a cheat. The way I prefer it is how it works as a pickup in Quake. But it works with Survival mode. It fits right in and makes the mode so much more fun.

Now that i'm done with the gamemodes. Let's move on to the rest of the game. There is a shop to buy things with your points you've collceted for either playing for an extended amount of time or for completing a mission or match. Now this isn't a problem. You may want to buy new guns with these points. Oh wait. YOU CAN't. THERE ARE NO SINGLE GUNS LISTED IN THE SHOP. ONLY THING AVAILABLE IS WEAPON PACKAGES THAT COST REAL USD. I can't overexagerate how stupid companies are when they place a pay 2 win system in their games. And these guns can be seriously overpowered in some matches. It really shows that games like these don't care about your experience, but your money.

Let me explain my overall gameplay feeling. I can't enjoy Zombie mode, so i'm gonna skip that. Original mode is actually not all that bad. At first I was confused, but it was a quick adjustment. I think Original mode allows for players to pick up new guns they bought and try to test them against other players, to see if it was really worth the purchase. You can play on all the old CS 1.6 maps, including dust2 and italy, And with the game's updated player graphics, it actually feels really nice. Survival mode is amazingly fun and the only reason you should actually sit down and play this game.

I don't recommend this game. Only because of it's poor Zombies mode, which is how the game was advertised, and because of the Pay2Win system. If this game got rid of some things, it'd be a fun addition to the CS series, but I can't find all my fun in it. Yes, Survival is great and all, but that doesn't mean i'm gonna sit there 24/7 gunning down massive waves of enemies. Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies tries it's best to fit in with the rest of the franchise, but some factors just kick it to the curb.

*UPDATE* (As of 10/26/14)
I've read peoples messages, comments, etc. And all I keep finding is the complaint of needing to play for more than an hour before writing a review. First off, I played a good 50 minutes. Sorry if I was 10 away from the 1 hour mark. Second, I don't remember the point where playtime resulted in a fun game. If there are so many reviews on this game, with low playtime, wouldn't that hint you that it wasn't an overall enjoyable experience, causing us to put down the game?

I'm still sticking with all my points. I really don't see any reason to change what I feel about them. The game dissapointed me, so I only sat through 50 minutes of it. I have more fun playing L4D2 than this.

reviewText:
Alright, Its about time i give this game a review in depth. Do know before you begin reading this review that this is a very HONEST review. Even though some aspects of this game aren't the most ideal and great i do still enjoy this game till today. Please feel free to edit me if any way if i misunderstood some aspects of this game, I am always open to new ideas. Sorry for the essay guys xD!

Positive:
- Large variety of guns to select from.
- Alot of different modes and maps to choose and play from.
- Family and groups to hang out with.
- Old counter strike maps to play on.
- Have both PvP And PvE.
- A nice story line.
- A nice community who are willing to help out.
- Most of the computers can run this game smoothly.

Negative:
- Requires a lot of grinding.
- Alot of campers in this game.
- Very loud and unbalanced sound.
- Very unbalanced weapons.
- Really bad graphics.
- Game layout may be difficult for new players to navigate.
- Many of the weapons and items you get in the game are durable.
- There isn't alot of english players in this game.
- Events are quite repetitive in this game
- There are bugs in some of the maps and modes.

Now lets get to the hot topic of this game.

Is this game a free to play game?

Before i answer this question i just want you guys to know that this game is heavily based on luck and the following answer is based on players who are just normal players with normal luck going into the game.

This game is a free to play game if you don't mind having a bunch of durable weapons and items. Being killed by other players with better weapons. Being killed by zombies in the zombie hero mode or zombie scenario. However you can still enjoy the different modes and maps without paying a single penny! This is what you will experience if you are willing to invest in at around 15 hours into this game.

This however can be changed but it requires a large amount of grinding and a few hundred hours invested into the game. Now lemme explain the systems in this game and how it works.

This game like i said before offers a lot of durable weapons and items. However if you do want permeant weapons and don't want to pay a single penny it is still very possible. This method will require you to invest at least a few hundred hours if you are a player who has a average luck like i do. Now the ways you can earn permeant weapons are through events (Do know that many events don't offer permeant weapons), crafting, extension coupons, mileage decoders and by bingo boards. Now lemme go through briefly each of these systems.

Events:
Events in this game sometimes offer decoders and supreme decoders (Most are really few to nothing) and gives out weapons at times depending on the month. Some of the weapons given like the christmas weapons have a duration. Other events like the spell the weapon name event gives permeant weapons however doesn't have much of a difference compared to the default weapons.

The crafting system:
This system is mostly used when you complete daily missions, grind zombie kills and decomposing your weapons (Most popular one) Now to actually have a chance of even getting a permeant weapon you need to sythensize and combine your durables to 72 days - permeant. Do know that this process can fail and result you with nothing left. Now if you were lucky enough to go through that you also have to do the same with the blueprints. After all that is done you still aren't offered a 100% chance at getting a permeant craft you still have the chance to fail. From my hours and i may just have been a really unlucky guy after a few hundred hours into the game i have only crafted one permeant weapon. This is just one way to earn a permeant weapon.

Extension coupons:
Now to earn extension coupons you can either get this from decoders or by disasembling weapons. When you disasemble weapons and if you are doing this right with a large amount of weapons you have the chance of earning a few extension coupons. When you open decoders you have the chance to win around 20 extension coupons ++ and the max you can earn i believe is around 500. With that you need to save up to 999 extension coupons with that you can then make one permeant weapon.

Mileage decoders:
Mileage decoders are like buying lottery or opening lottery the chances of earning permeant weapons can be scarce at times and won't get you much. If you are lucky you can get some permeant weapon at your first opening. However if you are unlucky you can open a hundred decoders and not get a single permeant weapon.

Bingo board:
In the bingo board you can pick up some really good permeant weapons. However to be able to use the bingo board you will need to open decoders which will grant you 30 to around 50 mileage points. Now you are only able to earn 3 mileage decoders a day which requires you to play a total of 3 hours. With these mileage points you can choose to reset your board to get good permeant weapons which requires 50 mileage points and changing the grand prize for 350. Now as you advance in the bingo board your opening special numbers will increase and so will opening random numbers making you need to grind and farm more for permeant weapons. In general if you are a free to play player it will require a large amount of game time and investment.

Weapon upgrade event:
When the weapon upgrade event comes around you can upgrade non permeant weapons into permeant weapons but with a even stronger form then its previous. This event usually brings 4 weapons that can be upgraded into the game. All you have to do is just open a few mileage decoders or craft the weapon which is quite easy if you save up alot of mileage decoders or blue prints and is another way to earn powerful and permeant weapons.

If you can endure everything i have just mentioned above, install and play away it is indeed a free to play game if done right. I just want to say that i do enjoy this game and i really like it and would recommend it to my friend. However i just wanted to do a honest in depth review of the game. I still love this game though! It is still part of my favorites! Anyway thanks for reading!

reviewText:
In its current state, Counter Strike Nexon: Zombies leaves a lot to be desired.

Servers:
I'm not sure if this is the case for NA players or those outside Europe in general, but playing this game off a stable internet connection in the European servers was not enjoyable whatsoever. Every few seconds (it varied, really) the server would freeze up briefly, leaving me to struggle to do anything and rendering the game virtually unplayable.

Options, UI and general game stability:
Let's start with options first... And we're done. Honestly; all I could see in the Video section of the Options was the ability to change the resolution, screen display mode (which consisted of 'widescreen' and 'regular' - I've no idea what 'regular' is supposed to mean) and the mandatory brightness/gamma. No advanced options whatsoever.

Under the audio section you have your usual sliders for SFX Volume and Music (Music I'd recommed you turn right down, as not only is it ear-rapey on first start up, it completely overlaps ingame SFX too), Sound Quality settings (High and Low - no medium?) And a few tickboxes for enabling EAX Hardware Support and A3D Hardware Support (I've no idea what these are either).

As for Mouse and Keyboard, it's your generic Source Engine options set up, with a depressing lack of 'Raw Input' tickboxes. I suppose it makes up for this with the 'Mouse Filter' tickbox, but it's just not the same.. :( Also, it features rebindable keys for all modes in the game, which was nice to see, abeit it being mandatory anyway. The option to invert the mouse it also included.

The 'Multiplayer' section is the most confusing and deceiving section of this Options menu. Reason being that it appears all nice and fine with it's ability to change crosshair (looks, colour, size and whether you want it translucent or not) and spray settings (yeah, custom sprays!) But then throws in a curveball with it's 'Advanced' section. Put simply, it seems like the Developers had no idea where to put spare options and dumped them in there. In this 'Advanced' section you'll see settings for map objects (like the amount of dropped magazines and bodies on the floor), smoke effect quality and volume, as well as UI settings. There is also a bunch of tickboxes for the radar, as well as ones for ingame options (like the UI)

Speaking of which, the UI is awful. Okay, well maybe not THAT awful, but it's still pretty bad. The buy menus are relatively confusing for first-time Counter Strike players and the UI for your weapons and ammo etc are placed in peculiar locations that require the user to look in certain places to see what they've picked up (thus distracting them from that AWP-er lining their sights up on them). This said, there is an option to set the UI to 'classic' which I assume is supposed to be like CS: Source or 1.6, but I personally didn't notice a difference.

In terms of stability, the game hold up pretty well. The only times I crashed was when trying to close the game, which didn't matter that much. Though I'd like to mention that changing the resolution will force the game into fullscreen unless you tick the box that enables windowed. About the resolution changes too, I had to reboot the game a couple times to actually see the option for 1920x1080, only to realise that it only changes to that resolution when you're in a match, then to default back to windowed when navigating the main menu (why it does that, I don't know). This game is also awfully hard to ALT+TAB out of while in fullscreen, it'll likely take a good couple seconds (maybe more) to minimise, oddly.

Gameplay:
The gameplay is fairly standard; shoot Terrorists as Counter Terrorists, plant bomb as Terrorists - usual CS basics right there, so I won't be covering the 'Original' game mode (which only consists of 1 map - Dust II). What this game does bring that is completely unique to CS are the 'Zombies' modes.

The first, and main, mode (called 'Zombie Scenario') is 'meh', to be honest. It'll usually consist of you buying an M249, walking forward, and holding down right mouse, while occasionally interacting with the objects in the environment to further the mission. This game mode also brings it's own 'story' (for lack of better term) in which you play a set amount of these missions in a linear order. I assume the missions vary in type, but I sadly didn't get far enough through the first one without boring myself to death to experience the others.

The second, lesser important, mode (called 'Zombie Hero') is essentially stock Counter Strike but with the Terrorists playing as the zombies. Sounds cool, huh? Well it is until you realise that, when playing as 'Terrorists', you'll mainly be hiding around corners or chasing the Counter Terrorists in the hopes of getting a kill before you're inevitable demise and wait period until the next round begins.

Thankfully, the guns in this game do handle like the ones CS Veterans will be familiar with, sticking true to the CS concepts and basics.

Miscellaneous:
Being a free game, there's most likely going to be strings attached, right? Well yes, that's correct, and Counter Strike Nexon: Zombies comes up far from short on that front. Upon opening the game you'll be barraged with rewards of items that are used in an extremely complicated crafting system (I'll talk about this later) as well as friendly info that there's a shop. In this shop you can spend points that I assume you can earn ingame (this isn't specified) and through paying real money. These points are used for buying items that you're only allowed to use for a set period of time before having to rebuy (you have the option to buy it for 10 days or pay extra for 30 days). You can also spend real money on different player models, weapon packages and xp boosts.

Crafting:
Mentioned previously, the crafting system is pretty confusing at first, but easy to get the hang of. It works like unboxing, you put in the 'Blueprints' that contain a set amount of items (they're dropped depending on your play time, and come in numbered tiers - the higher number the better), put in the 'Durable' part (this'll decide how long you get to use your crafted item for) and voila! You get the chance to craft some god-tier item or something really rather useless. On a sidenote, the crafting can actually fail, meaning you lose your Blueprint and Part (seriously man, just like unboxing...)

To conclude this lengthy review (and give those too lazy a brief TL;DR), I wouldn't recommend Counter Strike Nexon: Zombies until the Developers can add incentives to make waiting for the download to finish worth it. Though, if you have the internet to download it quickly, go ahead and give it a try. Who knows? You might find enjoyment out of it.

Thanks for reading, and have fun!

reviewText:
I feel as though this game had potential, but it wasn't used and overall I feel the game had poor design. While I would say if you didn't have 1.6 this could be an alternative given the team deathmatch mode, there are changes in movement and physics that really mess it up. It should have been made in the CS:GO engine for improved graphics and other things (you don't need much to run CS:GO anyway) and I don't think it should really be a standalone game. It is just a mod.

I played Zombie Escape which involved me following arrows on a map which looked open - but turned out to be very linear, just the same thing every round. It was an ok concept for a game/gamemode, but it lacked any enjoyment for me - and I sometimes found myself stuck in the walls of the map, just waiting for my demise. Then it happened as a zombie, and I couldn't do anything - so I quit the server.

So this review doesn't go on forever, here are my pros and cons about the game:

PROS:

-The game is free so you don't waste any money trying it out (unless you use the microtransactions...)
-Some good concepts for gamemodes which could be improved and expanded upon more

CONS:

-Some people don't like free to play - so I'm putting that here too.
-Microtransactons
-COD-Style Levelling
-Bugs (Stuck in walls, game not starting correctly to name a few)
-Made in the 1.6 engine rather than using something more up-to-date
-Linear arrow following in what could have easily been a more expansive world to play in
-Movement changes from 1.6 make it somewhat unfamiliar to 1.6 players
-Gets repetitve quickly
-It could easily have just been a mod, and some of the gamemodes are probably playable in Gmod
- YOU DON'T MOVE FASTER WITH YOUR KNIFE OUT

Overall I would say this game is a 4/10 as it's features are rather lackluster. I feel as though Nexon have let us down, as I was somewhat looking forward to this game when I first heard about it. These are just my opinions though, and as the game is free you can try it out if you would like.

reviewText:
DON'T take everyone's word on this game. Try it for yourself before you judge it.

At first I was pretty skeptical myself, reading all the crappy reviews saying how bad this game is, etc etc. After playing my first game I have to admit, I thought it was a deal breaker and I was about to uninstall it. But then I decided to give it another shot, and I actually had a good time! See here's what people are missing.

1.) It's very different than most FPS games. You can't move when you get shot. Accuracy isn't even added into the game, or atleast very little. But that's what makes it more challenging. More fun. More rewarding to get kills. It matters more that you have to be in the right position, and be clicking that mother‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing mouse as fast as you can.

2.) It's got that old Valve half-life engine. Oldish graphics and sounds that make it actually nostalgic for old time gamers.

3.) You can't take it seriously. I've played my fair share of counterstrike:source and what not. And I have to say I love both now. Both games are enjoyable with a group of friends. In this game, you're more than likely going to get killed by some BS.

4.) Nothing is permanent, except for some customizations and what not, but it's not solely dependent on players who pay for their equipment. You can still play fair". You can still buy things in the shop that are temporary
date: but attainable. You can still get kills. So to be fair
hoursPlayed: It's not "pay to win".\n\nAll in all
voteText: it's glitchy but enjoyable. I mainly play gun deathmatch

reviewText:
This is pretty much a mush-up of CS 1.6 and CS:CZ merged together with CS:GO-Market then added on-top of the unholy mixture. It perverts the damn scene by using Counter-Strike in its name when it is NOT a true CS game and never will be.

Avoid at all damn costs. F2P is great if there weren't so many better choices with the one time pay for CS 1.6, CS:S and CS:GO. Nexon is running on ancient gear, the game feels like its more of a money machine than an actual competitive, cooperative, fun game and if you really need Zombies, there are still great servers in CS:S, CS:GO continues to grow some more and honestly, if it wasn't for the CS part, this game would be another DayZ flop.

The Mixed Reviews are very warranted, keep reading your queue. I tried it and ran after seeing the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• DRM Launcher they force you to use. Also, notice the lack of VAC? I could hack the launcher and give myself the ol spinbotting. And I hate cheating. That's how ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•-poor this game is.

Newbies: Do not let this game be your introduction to Counter-Strike. Download CS:GO instead. http://blog.counter-strike.net/ Yes, CS:GO has Micro-transactions and a market like Nexon but you get no stat bonuses, its all purely cosmetic and the true point of it is to make yourself more individual than generic. You can pick what you want and if you no longer want it, you can sell it. Compared to the $24.99 dragon set in the listed DLC, you can sell $24 worth of ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• in CS:GO and get over half of it back if you're careful.

Good luck!

reviewText:
I have played many CS games before, but I mainly played CS:S and CS:GO. And this game is nothing like CS. If you think CS:GO is nothing like CS, just look at this.

Graphics:
The graphics are borrowed from a game from 1999. Graphics in a game don't matter, but it does help if you do manage to UPDATE THEM? There is no excuse to use graphics from 1999, considering this is a game from 2014, but at least the graphics are bearable.
Grade: D-

Animations:
The animations are borrowed from CS 1.6, which would be fine, but this is a tense, action packed game. The slow reload animations meant for a tactical, slow-paced FPS doesn't fit in the game. Sometimes, the animations don't even work, and I'll think the gun broke, only to realize it just didn't display and manage to waste a round into a wall. The death animations for the zombies don't make sense. Most of them are just kneeling to the ground, rising, and falling again. I'm not a master in physics, but I'm pretty sure getting shot by an AWP, a .308 winchester rifle, would at least throw back the zombies instead of forcing them to kneel. CS 1.6 managed to make different animations for getting killed in different place (shot in stomach, shot in head, shot in back etc.) and THAT was made in 1999, so why not this?
Grade: F-

Gameplay:
Terrible. This is nothing like CS. This is fast-paced and action packed, unlike CS' slow-paced, tactical action. The weapons feel too powerful, as even a gun weak like the Glock 17 can kill a zombie in 1 or 2 hits. The start screen is pretty, but user-UNfriendly. I accidently joined a game trying to join a normal game. There are way too many zombies in the co-op game heading at you, and even though I set my gun as the AUG, I still get the machine gun that empties in 5 seconds. Despite it being action-packed, I often got very bored.
Grade: F--

Sound:
Can't really judge this, as the game borrowed many, many sounds from CS 1.6, but the music is very loud. I often couldn't  hear anything when music played.
Grade: F

Verdict:

The game is a cluster‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• of zombies coming at you, with loud music and animations that don't help the game. It doesn't deserve to have Counter Strike" in the title. Fans of counter strike
date: this is not your game. I suggest any CS game but this.\nGrade: F-"

reviewText:
It's basically Counter-Strike 1.6 (‚ô•) with slightly improved graphics and gameplay (I really like the crosshair with a dot in the middle) and elements from the famous Zombie Plague mode, merged with a pay-2-win shop system that really reminds me of Wolf Team (and other similar games).

Yeah, there's a shop system in this game...

...but I'm not going to be a whiny bit·¥Ñh about it (check most of the non-recommended reviews), because I'm not forced to spend money on this, since I can just play on regular 1.6-style servers with all the original characters and weapons.

A thing that did annoy me about this game is the removal of tons of console commands and the ability to have an own user config (the famous autoexec.cfg") is gone
date:
but I think this can be added in future updates.

--- Edit ---
I'd like to add that I'm not mad at the shop system: weapons can be crafted so easily without spending real life money (there's even a chance of getting permanent items) and the only "pay2win" aspect of the game are some crappy female skins with irritating death sounds that you can quickly frag. Yes
recommended: there's people who waste money on that (well
hoursPlayed: Nexon has to make some profit somehow)."

reviewText:
Yes, I'm re-writing my review.
Yes. I've played every CS before this (except Promod, Neo, and 2D).
This is going to be a long review.
Full review at the bottom

Okay so before I start this off, I wanna say this: If you really liked CS 1.6, CS:CZ, or CSO, you're going to love this. Yes I know it's a Nexon game, but trust me when I say this, this is a fun game.

I'm honestly really tired of people giving this game hate when they've only played the game for 0.3 hours and gave the game a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• score because they had no idea what they were doing. If you actually play the different gamemodes, relive the old classic maps, join families, play with friends, this'll be one of the best CS games you'll ever play. So yes. It's not just zombies. It's everything you could ever want!

Pros of this game
+It's Free To Play
+IT'S NOT PAY TO WIN
+A variety of new weapons
+Tons of gamemodes
+GIRLS IN COUNTER-STRIKE
+Ranking System that is far better from CS:GO's BS ELO Ranking system.
+Families and Clans
+Rankings
+Achievements
+Daily Missions to keep it fresh
+All the classic maps and guns from the original CS titles are here.
+Zombie modes are fun once you know what your doing
+Community is mostly friendly and not cancer like CS:GO
+GMs are always listening to community feedback and constantly update the game!
+Runs great for older PCs.

Cons of this game -Small playerbase (we all know why)
-Main Menu is confusing for first time players and is stuck in a 4:3 resolution.
-Zombie Shelter and Zombie Mutant are BORING.
-The game is very grindy when you reach level 25.
-Graphics are dated"
-Not available in a few countries

So do I recommend this game? ABSOLUTELY! This game is free and many fun times can happen in this game. If this is your first CS
date: you may really enjoy this. If you care for graphics that much.......... go play CS:GO. The ammount of missions
hoursPlayed:
guns there are in the game keeps me coming back for more!

TL;DR / Summary
This is basically a port of CSO. IF you enjoyed CS 1.6

or CSO you'll love this! Tons of variety and fun to be had when playing CSN:Z. GIVE THIS GAME A CHANCE BEFORE YOU JUDGE IT!

Overall Rating 9/10

reviewText:
Alright, I'm probably going to be like, one of 7,7k people who reviewed this game and I actually say something good about it. I won't lie, I REALLY enjoy this game.

More guns, fun game modes, sometimes huge challenge and yes game is kind of broken, but broken things usually are fun at least for me. It's true, zombie scenario mode have issues, It's so freakin annoying when you have to shoot something for 98342785423 hours just to destroy another thing that takes even more time to destroy, but I do liked A LOT boss battles. This game ISN'T pay2win. You can get everything important for free, like blueprints and materials by daily login rewards or mission rewards or by random drop in the game. If you want to have other player model or have some more stuff, go on and pay for it, support developers, but you really don't have to do that. And hey, CS1.6 for free. With all those new awesome guns.

Of course, game has flaws. Like I mentioned before, repetitive Zombie Survival and really annoying Zombies will be back"

reviewText:
So at first: Sorry for my english, im still improving :D
Second thing - This review was created during BETA of the game !!!

If anyone ever played Zombie mode in any CS, they know what this is. In the game all players are humans. After few seconds one of you becomes Zombie. One hit = Become Zombie. Humans have to survive for few minutes and Zombies have to turn all humans into zombies. The game is acceptable as a Human, but as a Zombie you will have hard times. If group of humans shoots at you, there is nothing you can do - you can barely move, you cant shoot (maybe you can with different zombies but i was not able to do so) Unfortunately, most players feels to be heroic and just run around in open area. There are also alternative gamemodes for this, for example when one of humans becomes a Hero" with special gun.

Other gamemode is zombie survival (or how its called)
recommended: but is actually pretty bad. All players play for half hour in same small area. Every wave many zombies spawn everywhere... and you literraly have to keep turning around to kill everything thats coming your way. If someone was spectating
hoursPlayed:
they would think that you are dancing.

Zombie Scenario... or something like that... there are randomly chosen few random zombies to chase humans. They have to follow the signs and run. Sometimes they have to press something or shoot something. As a zombie you actually have to do the same... but instead of trying to escape - youre trying to hit them and turn them into zombies. I had slightly more fun playing this gamemode.

The highlight of this game is Zombie Shelter mode. You have shelter and you have to protect it. During day you have to gather resources around the map
voteText: look for black market to buy a weapons. During night there will be horde of zombies trying to destroy your shelter. With resources you can build turrets
helpfulPercent: walls and other buildings. To win
votesHelpful:
you have to kill two bosses.

There is lot of alternative gamemodes to these and there is also a "Original" and "Basic" gamemode. Thats just classic CS 1.6 with small changes.

Main Menu feels very uncomfortable. Craft menu contains pointless PIN code screen. If you try to end the game
votesTotal:
game will try to convince you to keep playing with "You havent finished your Special mission" or "You did not accepted your daily reward"... Even leaving the game before the end of match will result in loosing 100 points. I have no idea what are those points for.

+ Lot of gamemodes
+ Shelter Mode
+ New weapons
+ Players of older Zombie mods will love this

- Gameplay as Zombie
- Main Menu
- Some booring gamemodes

5/10
Im giving it a Thumb Up

reviewText:
As a long time Counter Strike player I really enjoy this game and here is why:

- Tons of different modes to play including PVP and PVE (original, deathmatch, gun game, infection, zombie scenario etc...).
- Old and new maps (dust, dust 2, assault, italy, militia, office, nuke, prodigy and more!)
- Lots of new weapons and items! (melee, pistols, smgs, shotguns, rifles, snipers, machine guns and even rocket launchers!!!
- Daily, weekly and even monthly missions which rewards players with blueprints or durables after completing them.
- Events which can help earn more XP and Points (in game currency used to buy and craft items).
- Ranking system, competitive play.
- Can create families (like clan thing).
- Logging each day awards you with items.
- Playing gets you rewards which are used to craft weapons and other helpful stuff.
- Zombies!!!
- More things yet to come!

Now, this game does have optional microtransactions but there are not required and most of the items and weapons can be acquired just by playing and crafting except for skins/classes but that could change in the future and items such as medkits and revivals can be purchased with in game points/currency.

I am also aware that Counter Strike Nexon: Zombies is known as Counter Strike Online in Asian markets but it wasn't available anywhere else till now.

So far (as of writing of this review) I haven't experienced any major issues with the game and I've already put over 200 hours into it. My favorite modes are Zombie Scenario and Human Scenario.

Game does look old but the gameplay is still fun and anyone can play since it has very low system requirements.

If you liked old Counter Strike 1.6 and Counter Strike Condition Zero you should check this one out because this game is free to play and you got nothing to lose so go ahead and give it a try :)

PS: Ignore all the negative reviews and check out this game yourself since it doesn't take long to download and it doesn't take much disk space either.

reviewText:
Popular sequels* to the original Counter-Strike in the past have tried to maintain the magic of the original whilst creating their own legacy. Though they gained moderate success in their time (perhaps due to a lack of true competitors) it is only now we have the clarity to see what a farce these 'sequels' were.

Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies (CSNZ) reinvents the wheel whilst it's predecessors only put new tires on. In a true blend of 'East meets West meets East turned West national' a brilliant game is born. A true step forward for Counter-Strike history. This is comparable to Hideo Kojima's fusion storytelling of Eastern and Western cliches holds a great mirror to it's references and makes for a truly unique experience.

CSNZ is if John Woo met Resident Evil Dawn of the Dead. It's an instant classic and it's only a matter of time before the player base cultivates and redefines eSports.

I give it 10 steams.

--
*Counter-Strike: Condition Zero, Counter-Strike: Source, Counter-Strike: Global Offensive

reviewText:
Crashed a few times.. but the rewards they're giving us, the games, the zombies and the boss fight just leaves me playing this game for HOURS! I recommend this game to anyone who likes Counter Strike games such as myself now onto the game modes:

-Original Basically it's like 1.6 no zombies no nothing.. just normal gameplay
-Beast 2 teams have a generator and kill people and collect their gems and you can turn into a horrible monster I'll let you find out the rest..
-Zombie hero Basically a zombie host gets chosen and attacks the humans to infect them.. In humans a hero gets chosen and he's harder to kill basically and gets better guns
-Zombie Shelter Basically a big map and you have to collect supplies to build a base and defend against zombies or enemy players if you're playing PvP
-Zombie Escape Big map and zombies.. zombies are invincible and chase the humans the humans have to get to the safe area, if the zombies get there first then tough luck
-Soccer One of my personal favorites it's basically 1 or 2 balls and.. you know the rest

These are just a taste of what you're gonna face.. so download this game and find out what lies within.

reviewText:
Geez, look at all these negative reviews. Seriously guys, can we accept that this isn't CS for the competitive crowd? It's a free-to-play spinoff, for cripes sake. Ease off a little.

The game itself is one big guilty pleasure. I shouldn't be enjoying a free to play game - I shouldn't be enjoying the Skinner Box that is crafting - I shouldn't be enjoying overpowered weapons that have a time limit - and I most certainly shouldn't be enjoying CS turned into a rankfest, and yet... I am.

There's something undeniably charming about anime player models, enslaved" zombies
date: and tacky weapon skins. Coupled with the fact this game has been in development since 2008 and has gotten a plethora of game modes since then
recommended: I'd say it's at least worth a shot."

reviewText:
Hello, this is my review of Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies.

I liked zombie mode on counter strike 1.6, and zombie escape too. But i fell in love when i got to play it on CS Source i said, holy ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• this is AWESOME , half of my hours on CS source are on zombie escape. So one day  i though, this is so good, why do not anybody makes a game about this?. Oh boy. When i saw counter strike nexon zombies i said, hmmmm counter strike and zombies gj valve, i though at the moment.

So i opened the game and the problems started even before i joined a match, i clicked play and i waited like 10 minutes because an anti-cheat stuff was analyzing me, i was like OK, im sure i wont find bad people or hackers on this game at least.

The menu is kind of league of legends style, so i did not say anything. reviewText: Ok, where to start...\nWell starting this is quite possibly the worst game I've ever played and its buggy as hell. Graphics are from CS 1.6 so it looks terrible but runs good on a potato with a screen stuck in it, running on the power source of a toaster. I mean seriously you cant focus on the graphics?! I've seen Facebook games with better graphics! It's CS zombie mode with Nexon slapped on it, btw if you have ever played a Nexon game and you dont like p2w, DO NOT! Secondly it's EXTREME P2W. Textures are horrible, guns are like they are from a COD game, voice acting stolen from 10 year old prirated B-movies, and AI mapping that will completly screw you over with a spoon. PLUS this is the ultimate UNINSTAL SIM 2014 -1000/1 not even worth the *Free* download.

reviewText: C-S 1.5 was first realistic f.p.s. Guns act as a real weapon would, recoil ,reloading and reduced accuracy while moving..All who say this is a bugged mod have no clue what a real gun is - this was the first gaming engine to enter phsyics of actual guns and how they react when fired and damage according to hit and kevlar/ no kevlar..Zombies a lil o.p. in some scenarios while weak in others...Weapons are best part of this version , many more than original c-s , some from other c-s mods, day of defeat, and half-life, melee weaps. also fun,,weapon crafting easy to do and always fun to be a zombie infecting others..A definite for any C-S fan , a lil wierd to play after modern source version but still One of best free 2 play out there. Have Found myself yelling at comp and then 5 min later laughing hysterically at zombies...Not many games can do that..

reviewText:
Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies is in my opinion, a terrible Counter Strike game. It is however an average Asian f2p shooter. I am not good at describing this one to you all, so I think I will do a pros and cons list below.

Pro> Free to play (ish)

Pro> Has Zombies

Pro> Everyone sucks equally bad for the most part...
------------------------------------------------------------------
Con> Connection Terminated

Con> Uses Counter Strike Name

Con> plays like a terribly bug filled version of classic Counter Strike

Con> Pay to win (maybe?) I haven't fully got a grasp on if this game is pay to win or not, its still a maybe for me


Really its up to you to play, I will eave this one at your discretion. It is times like these that I wish for a way to leave neutral reviews/ recommendations.

reviewText: Well it's official, I have quite a game only 10 mins after starting it for the first time. It is a very confusing game because it is marketed as a version of Counter-Strike with Zombies, but acts more like a free to play shooter that happens to have similar textures that look worse than Counter-Strike: Source. Not only are the textures terrible, but it is not possible to run the game at any form of high resolution. I run all my games at 1600:900 which is absent from this game all together. Now for the gameplay, it is just flat out terrible. There are two types of games in this game all about micro-transactions, which are sort of traditional Counter-Strike PvP and some terrible version of infection game types. The normal Counter-Strike PvP feels terrible and is a poorly made PvP game type. It is just traditional deathmatch with very simple spawn points with conflict only being in the middle of a very boring designed map. Then the zombies PvP is the same thing as the traditional PvP, just with one team being zombies. It is exactly like any custom server you can play on with the traditional Counter-Strike: Source, and looks worse. The game is heavily based on it's micro-transactions, making it so guns are just trials" that you have for like 1 to 3 days. This game is very poorly made and I do not plan to play again any time in the future."

reviewText:
This game actually has a bigger Community (Than the rest of the 1.6 community) and is very different in modes, style and gameplay

Pros: - It has a Crafting System, which you can use in Crafting Weapons, Combining Durables, Enhancing Weapons.
- Enhance Durables by Combining them in the  Synthesis Tab  to craft a weapon, that lasts much longer
- Very different Weapons.
- Daily Mission System
- Clan System
- Matchmaking System
- Many different Gamemodes
- Easy Hosting

Cons: - It's either Pay 2 Win or Play 2 Win on Scenarion Game Modes
- Impossible or takes too much time to do all the daily Missions without a Clan
- Disadvantage at % Damage done to bosses if other players have those very strong Skull weapons, which gives you worse rewards at the end.
- In 1.6 Zombie Mode had way more fun. *UPDATE 1*

Overall
It is a pretty nice and enjoyable game, which is also playable.
If you play it in a Clan you can farm the daily missions and the bonus daily missions to get Durables/Weapon Grades almost impossible doing missions without a Clan so you have to play a very long time to get to a permanent Durable for a Chance to get a Permanent Weapon. Combining in Crafting could also fail so you have to play again and again and sometimes it gets boring if you do that everyday, alone and without Friends.

Rating 79/100

Playable and Enjoyable

reviewText:
OK first off, this is and always will be one of my favorite games of all time. Im talking about CS 1.6... But besides that, This game is actually very fun


Your able to get premium weopons without paying for them, so long as you just play

The only thing that they have to buy currently are players and weopon crafting stuff, witch isnt needed. KEEP IT THIS WAY

Counter strike is one of my favorite games of all time. I play it alot

Hackers havnt been a problem yet


Its made by nexon, so sooner or later there will most likely be NX shoved down the throat of this game. Leaving nothing behind but people who pay to win. Witch isnt reccomended, you guys there at nexon have enough money to fully fund the cure for cancer 5 times over. So dont F that part up

```````````````````
Bad stuff
```````````````````

Made by Nexon

The recoil in this game... NEEDS ALOT of work. When im aiming down the sights with my revolver with my scope, and the dots right on the guy, and i still see the bullet wiz to the right or left or any direction and hit the wall behind him. I Freak out. Because I was aiming at him. Not moving. Crouched. Still missed, and it still happens here and there. I feel like the recoil in this game has specific percentages on how much your moving, if your crouched, and the crosshair does NOTHING to impact how and where you shoot. So fix it, seriously.

Family is a cool and new thing thats in this game. Its like a clan, only CS own little way of saying what it is. Manage it and send out notifications EXC. Join other familys, have storages that people can access....... The one thing that NEEDS to be set differently is the time on where you can join one family. What i mean by this is that when your in a family, you leave for some reason or another, and you wanna join another family. You HAVE to WAIT 2 weeks untill you can join another family. My friend was in a family before just to see how it is and all that, then he left and I invited him to my own that I made myself. He couldnt join and we were both ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• off, it doesnt tell you that you have to wait. It lets you go and makes you regret the decision. Fix that Please

The maps are cool, some are really small but hey, whatever ya know.

Game types are different from what ive seen in alot of games ~
Beast- Fight at a church and kill other people. Theyl drop these stones that anyone can grab, get three of them and turn into this big beast they call the yeti. Multiple people can use it at once and itl become a one big beast fight in the middle of the map to see who the fastest clicker is. Its decent

TDM/Original/Bot TDM/ Arms race / DM

Basic gamemodes that most FPS shooters have, same concept, different game, different guns, different maps.

Other gamemodes that are ok

Scenerios

` Basicly just one building, or area, where you the player choose your weopons and and fight big waves of bosses, and bots of couse. Each with there own set of health, weakpoints , weopons and killing styles. There are currently only 2 scenerios, Zombie and Human.

Weopons

` Theres quite a few for a just launched game. So Clap clap on that. Recoil needs help.

Melee

` Its decent, make sure to aim the crosshair right at the guy your trying to wrek. Otherwise youl miss and get humililiated.

Disc space isnt that much, maybe 3 GB, Good for a remake of a game


One other thing. Theres thing called Zombie Shelter.... WTF were you thinking when you made that gametype. Theres no tut, i had no idea what i was doing. Money making is ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, and when people leave on like round 5, and your all by yourself you might as well just quit. Cause when u die you lose everything, including money you took 5 hours to get. So when you see a match with that. Keep scrolling.

Theres Plenty more, but its 2 in the morning and i have school at 8 #Sophomore

EDIT_-_-_-_

Ok, so newest update came out. Cool.
Nothing i noticed really. Maybe connection stuff? They say trading cards are in, when i dont see any in my invetory!

Recoil is better though. Thank you on that one.

One other thing. I was playing in a match, and when all the terrorists were dead on DE_Dust2 the game wouldnt end. So we all ran around and attempted suicide many times,

Crafting needs updating. Ive been getting so many fails its not even funny. I bought a Weopon enhancment kit, and seriously 3-10 of them failed. WASTE of points, I get that it fails sometimes. But not 7 out of 10 times. So poo on that till it gets updated

reviewText:
Do you want an unrefined trash cash grab that is based on who has the largest wallet? Then here you go! You've found it!

This very poorly designed mod of the source engine is the classic example of people stealing something that is amazing and turning it into a sad attempt to grab cash and make this game an unplayable joke.

The loading is slow, fails half the time and throws a bunch of useless junk into your face that as a new player you have no idea what to take of it. You get daily encentives to log on every day, but the items you get are lousy and just be bought with several real dollars, so who cares? Why wait 7 days to get a random skin or gun you can just spend 2 dollars to get.

The regular mode is just an slightly altered version of the original counter strike, with the bots mod the only viable versus mode due to the rampant pay to win culture. The zombies defense can be fun if played with friends, but gets very busy and difficult hard, and to top this is the rediculous hit box zombies have, making it nearly impossible to even play anytihng but turret spam defense. The guns are garbage, late game the zones to buy ammo are nearly impossible to access due to poor zombie coding and the overall fact that this game is just ugly in colour.

It didn't take me very long to kick this game out of my libary, after just 10 minutes of looking at the main menu and jumping into a zombie game, me and my two friends instantly laughed at how bad this game is.

Don't try it, and expect only headaches from this pathetic money grab.

Personal Rating: 1/5

reviewText:
This is an abomination. Terrible game with trash community and you will barely find someone who speaks English but when you do he's going to curse at you. If you want to get the good weapons you'll have to spread your wallet wider than a woman spreading her legs when she's giving birth. Terrible pay to win game.
If you want to craft a permanent weapon...GOOD LUCK.

-It used to have missions that rewarded you with decoders and you had a fair chance at winning a permanent weapon but they removed them because apparently there were people who abused it. So instead of actually fixing the problem they just showed us how not to deal with it and removed them from the mission rewards. Now you will have to waste 3 hours of your precious time in this terrible excuse of a game so you can get 3 decoders.

- you can play bingo for nice rewards. But now that you can barely get any points from the decoders it'll take you months to actually get something. Did they really think this through? I don't think so...or maybe they just didn't care.

-Some skins are terrible. They blend in with some walls and you can barely see them from a far. Add a little bit of lag and you have it.

-Who in their right mind wakes up and says I'll make an invisible zombie that is able to jump high"? Fire that guy.

But we know that the reason is most likely so people would buy the decoders from the store. If they really valued their players they would do that but what do you expect from a game made to grab cash.

I regret every second I spent on this and I am here to help you guys so you won't do the same mistake. Do you see the amount of hours I spent on the game? This is the amount of times I had to get exorcism so I could get this abomination out of my system."

reviewText:
Ok, now that the server issuses have been fixed, I am giving a more accurate review.

Is this game any good? Well, it depends. The concept behind this game is solid, but it has a poor implementation. Out-dated graphics, for instance. Also, it tries to be a CoD: BO2 Zombies or modded CS:GO. In my opinion, it doesn't live up to either of those games. Black Ops 2 is really fun, I played Zombies a lot on my console, but it's worth the time you'd put into it. This, at the moment, isn't.

If you want to play it, go ahead. It's your time, and not mine.

Will update if anything changes.

reviewText: Interesting  game and idea, based off the CS:S zombie mod.  The build mode looks like it could potentially be fun.  As of beta, clipping issues are horrible.  Latency is less than 100, and i can't tell if I'm hitting the zombies or not.  i NEVER see damage coming, so it's impossible to avoid.  Overall it just runs terribly. Also, there's no real 'instructions' on the 'build mode'.  Someone managed to get a gun, told me i needed to find an ATM.  I did, but couldn't do anything with it.  Something the intially looked/sounded awesome quickly turned into frustration, and i lost interest completely.\n\nThe main menu is even worse.  It's in an awful resolution, and there's so much information on the screen you can't take it all in.  As a novice logging into the game for hte first tiem, i just didn't even care to figure it out.

reviewText:
CSN:Z is a free-2-play version of Counter Strike which adds a zombie escape mode. There you have to escape the infected people or infect the humans as a zombie and prevent them from winning.

The awful thing in this mode is that if you are a new player that is in the human team with other new players, you will lose in just a minute. Any hit from the zombies is an insta-kill, so you have to keep moving and outrun the zombies. But, you can succeed more if you buy in-game stuff with your (parents', if you are a kid) card, more specifically waste your real money. Also the new weapons have a time limit, unless you craft a permanent gun. But you won't need to empty your pockets when you discover that this game also has the Original Deathmatch servers.

Yep, the classic CS gameplay: CTs vs Terrorists and struggle to win. It has all the popular maps such as Nuke and de_dust, all the weapons such as Deagle, AWP, MP5, P90. Here the only thing to win is to get skilled. Altough sometimes the hit detection is weird (e.g. once I got a headshot, even though it was a bodyshot), this mode is playable. Watch out for wall campers, there are more of them in this game than in 1.6!

In spite of the negative reviews I saw around here, CSN:Z offers a lot for a F2P game, and you can definetly have fun with it.

reviewText:
I played one match for around 7 minutes. As per usual with any game originating from a company in asian there is no Australian servers, and in this case there isn't even Oceanic. So to my fellow Australians, have fun getting hit from a map away with you 400 ping delay

Nexon has taken a mod that was just a bit of fun on CS, and made their own version of it with a pay to win scheme, and all the problems the original mod had. Which was basically that on some maps vent or crawlspace camping saw the humans dominate and on others it's impossible for the humans to win.

I do not recommend this game to anyone. I instead recommend you fire up CSS, CSGO and just find a community server with the zombie mod installed.

reviewText:
Another free to play game has launched, and this one seems to be a mess. Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies is a take on the classic Counter-Strike game, adding zombies to the mix across 50 maps of play and dozens of modes. Unfortunately my first impressions with the game were poor - a confusing interface, an engine based on Half-Life 1, and poor performance all yielded a sub par result in game play.

For the most part the game seems to feature a variety of competitive mode of play where the traditional teams of Terrorists and Counter-Terrorists face off, but must also face the zombie threat as second thread. While the game has added new weapons and characters, including female characters to play as, it still contains a lot of the classic look and feel with maps such as de_dust and de_metro present.
In terms of co-op, it appears there are two modes that support true co-op play. One is called Human Scenario" where you face off against an "army of computer controlled opponents." I played a few minutes of it and basically shot at drones barely making a dent in the boss's health with 6 other people. The other mode is called Zombie Shelter
date: which appears to have some sort of strategy elements too it
recommended: but also an optional PvP element. Players must secure a shelter and then repel waves of zombies."
hoursPlayed: October 12, 2014

reviewText:
This is best game ever i played. I am from polish (U know i am good english).Too much fun,Zombies and The Most Thing Bots.Bots are great for begginers.There are many gamemods like:
Zombies:
U know how to play
Escape Zombie:
In this gamemode you have escape,before players (Zombies) get you. You have limited time. If time gets 0 whetever or not zombie wins. There is not many map but its fun to play. Some escape must like how many distance you go,survive and wait for chopper,and others. The Most Points Wins!
Soccer:
Well Valve thank you for that adding this gamemode. Easy rule, get the ball,and get goal to get points. But hey! For getting close to enemy goal will couse damage you. And the most impoart you CAN respawn. If you die you will respawn where you die. The most points Wins!
Original:
You know what is this.
Zombie Save:
In this mode it never ends untill save house will be destroyed by zombies.It took me 2 Hours to end it.Its Very Fun. You cant win! Like a Soccer you respawn die. When you die you will respawn to save house+you lose all items what you got but thats ok for me. Well you can build sentry and others,that makes game long. It is fun,but boring for some players.
Zombie Co-Op:
In this gamemode you actully killing Bot Zombies,NOT players. In this mode is survive and escape,then chapter will change to boss battle,that means you need defeat boss to complete chapter. You lose if all players is dead. You can still have fun pressing r (I think) it will restart and you with friends trying again. Still you CAN respawn. But if you keep dying the time will make extend.
Thats all i can tell some gamemode.Others all there but i dont remember.

This is: BEST GAME EVER!!!!!!
9/10

reviewText: Awful awful game. As it is, you'll get some hours out of it but then you'll get sick and tired of the long matches. reviewText:
So I played this, and man, this game is not that bad!

Pros:

-Very easy to get into. I mean VERY easy. No tutorials, just choose a server and get into the game!
-The game just throws items at you, and you can have a great time without any microtransactions.
-1.6 on drugs. Seriously, the weapons are so out of place I actually like them. There are the music instrument AKs, weapons that look like Nerf guns and even a LEGO assault rifle that can be transformed into grenade launcher! Doesn't that sound cool?
-Solid zombie mod that uses the same 1.6 on drugs" principle. The most OP weapons and the most interesting character designs out of all Korean shooters.
-It is so good that just like the original 1.6 it became a standard for the (Korean) FPS games.

Cons:
-Menu. It is locked to 720p for some reason
recommended: just Alt+Enter from it. The game itself isn't locked though.\n\nVerdict: Pretty playable
hoursPlayed: but not suitable for competitive play. Just try it yourself and give your score."

reviewText:
Even with a low ping the game is incredibly laggy, to the point it's pretty much unplayable. There are MUCH better f2p games out there and sadly this one isn't very good.

The positives:
- Nostagia for those of us who played the original CS when it was a mod for HL.
- Sprays.
- The original de_dust map.

The Cons:
- Laggy to the point of being unplayable.
- Terribly outdated engine and graphics.

Overall:
Better to just get CS:GO and avoid this. 1/10 and the 1 is for nostagia. This game should have been on the current CS engine, or even use the original source engine. To use the original HL engine is beyond ridiculous.

reviewText:
For the record, this has been around in both regular and zombie variants in South Korea since forever. I don't get why Nexon would just bring this over here one day out of the blue, but here it is.

Anyway, Imagine a free to play version of that zombies mode everyone liked when they were 12, complete with microtransactions for guns and such, bundled with a few weird sven coop type missions. It's about as jankey as you'd think  korean CS 1.6 would be.

Don't play this, unless you want to find out how much of a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•how it is.

reviewText:
I know it is open beta, so the game isn't finished yet.

Bugs so far:
- Main screen is stuch on low res, messing up your screen settings. However ingame its all good to 1920 x 1080 which I use.
- Connection issues

Complaints that can't be fixed:
- it being half-life 1 engine, which these days is just not done. Unlike Quake Live which is a more smoot hand fluid engine, the half-life 1 engine isn't smooth enough these days for fast paced action. It's slow and clumsy and no scriptwriting can fix that.

As for the game being free to play: if you haven't played any Counter Strike game before and really want to have the good old experience, this might be just for you!

reviewText:
Do yourself a favor and avoid this game, this is not like CounterStrike at all.

I've played CS:1.6 and CS:CZ which are very good games and worth the asking price. This on the other hand is if you took those two games and mixed them with Battlefield Play4Free, and then took a huge dump on it.
The User Interface is all over the place and can be hard for new players to understand how to use it, and it litters you with all kinds of promotions and ads for items in the game. Although, once you finally understand how to navigate your way through the insane UI, you will quickly find out that it really is just a butchered version of CS:1.6 with micro transactions all over the place. The re-desings of the old CS maps are not all that great, everything feels way larger than it should feel and the new alternate versions of the maps are really nothing special. The audio is also like CS:1.6, only louder and in lower quality, even with all the audio options set to maximum.

Now for the big one, that being the zombie mode. To put it simply... it's very bad. It really feels like nothing more but the original zombie mod from all the other CS games, and dumbed down to it's simplest form. Either, run away from the zombies with no tactics or pre thinking what so ever, or run around shooting the zombies with no tactics or team work what so ever, and the zombie shelter mode is just so boring, with no pun intended, brain dead zombie ai walking around aimlessly while your turrets fill them with holes and send them back to their boring hell where they belong, or to heven if they are lucky enough.

Not to mention that this version of CounterStrike has no modding features what so ever, because all the events are actually rooms instead of independent servers. Instead, you choose from a couple main servers depending on your geographical location in real life. Because you know, CounterStrike was never known for all of it's mods and community made game modes it has.(To anyone who doesn't understand, that last sentence was sarcasm.)
I really am trying to find somthing good about to say about this game, other than you can choose from female characters, which is good. But saddly you can only get those if you give them 9.99 USD, which completely destroyed any positives or upcommings for this game.
There are some other things I forgot to mention like crafting and perks, but I have to be honest with you, I really couldn't bare anymore than fourty minutes with this game. Come to think about it, I would have probably have never heard about this game if it weren't for a Youtube I saw while watching a video. I wouldn't have even bothered with it if it weren't for the fact that it was a Free to Play" version of CounterStrike.

My final words to you are
date: if you think this is the Free to Play version of CounterStrike that you have been all waiting for
hoursPlayed: not even close. If you want to play CounterStrike
voteText: then buy any of the other CS games there are
helpfulPercent: but don't waste your time on this. I hate to say it but
votesHelpful: this game is a disgrace to the CounterStrike community.\n\n3/10 not recommended unless you are really looking for a Free to Play First Person Shooter."

reviewText:
Many people hate this game but I'm 1 of the people who like this game!

Want play CS and CZ for free? Yes, you can!

Want more weapons? Yes, a lot of weapons in CSN:Z and don't need to pay! You can get weapon from crafting by Durable + Blueprint that can get from playing, event, missions, etc. The new weapons such as ARX-160, Groza, M24, M14EBR, MG3, AT4, UTS15, TAR-21, Kriss Super V, M134 Minigun even WW2 weapons such as Luger, STG44, Mosin Sniper, MP40, etc.

Want more game modes? Yes, not just Original mode from CS or just Zombie mode but more than 20 game modes!!!!! Such as Soccer, Hidden, Battle Rush, Beast, Item Battle, Bazooka Battle, Challenge, Basic, Zombie Scenario, Human Scenario, Zombie Escape, Zombie Shelter, etc.

Want more maps? Yes, there are more than 50 maps!!

Want more characters? Yes, but only characters you need to pay to get them.

Want make a Clan here? Yes, You can create or join Family! The Family system is similar to Clan. It has Family Achievements for nice rewards, Oh, you or family members can share your/their weapons or characters to Family Storage! (Need to get some weapon permanent from crafting/events first, if you get it again you can bring that to family storage)

This game also has a ranking system but I don't know enough about this system, sorry!

Want nice missions system in Counter-Strike? Yes, there are 4 kind of missions. All missions will give you some rewards.
1. Special Mission - Challenge mission for player. Can you clear a special mission within 1 day? Such as 15 kills in Dust2 Original mode"
2. Daily Mission - There are 20 Daily Mission that you can do and it will reset in next day.
3. Weekly Mission - Mission that you must do with your family such as "Play with family members for 5 hours in Zombie mode". You have time 1 week to clear these mission for very nice reward.
4. Honor Mission (or Achievements) - The hardest mission in CSN:Z. Can you do these missions? for example: Clear all daily missions within a day for [Perfectionist] medal. The reward of Honor Mission is "Medal" and "Honor points". The medals can be used before a player's name. Example: [Perfectionist] PlayerName. You can change color of medal with your honor points. (100 = green
hoursPlayed: 1000+ = red)\n\nHuh? Zombies are hard to kill? Don't worry
voteText:
CSN:Z also has "Anti-Zombie" weapons that can do fatal damage to those zombies (This effect can be seen in Zombie modes only) You can get these weapons from crafting too!

All weapons from classic CS are in your Inventory for permanent! Zombie skins with different ability also added to your inventory for free and permanent!

Want play same as CS 1.6 ? Yes

there is a Original mode and you can setting your room to Classic Battle that only classic weapons is allowed in your room!

And don't miss the event in CSN:Z that you can get prize!

reviewText:
This is a very unique experience and totally changes the dynamics of counter strike. The PvE was somewhat dry in my opinion, and resembled Sven: Co-Op in that you essentially plow your way alongside other players through a linear map fighting back wave after wave after wave of enemy and completing certain tasks (usually blowing up a barrier that has 30,000 health) to get to the next area. There are buy zones interspersed for you to load up on ammo or switch out guns and it usually culminates in a big boss fight. It's kind of droll and there's not much of a challenge.

WHERE THIS REAAAALLLY ****REAAAAAAAAAAAALLLY**** shines however is the PvP mode where some people are zombies and some CTs each round (randomly selected).

Each zombie type has special powers, like an iron maiden it can slam down to stun enemies and hide behind, or a hoard of bats that grabs the human you aim it at and drags him toward you. The humans (CTs) have a slew of all the classic CS guns and some extras, with a much higher ammo capacity.

This mode can be SUPER intense as you spawn throughout familiar classic CS maps and try to get to high ground with other humans, since one hit from a zombie and you become one and join the hunt. Zombies have thousands of health points, but are slowed down by being hit so a group of humans can often protect themselves or give another a chance to excape, but once the guy next to you takes a scratch he'll kill you.

Playing with just a couple people is really cool too depending on the map... it becomes more like hide and seek and can be VERY intense. I played with 2 others on the classic estate map and I kept jumping as I was attacked out of nowhere, since the maps are darkened to create a tense ambience.

This mode makes it SO worth the download and since it is  free game, you've GOT to try it out... I was hooked after a couple rounds.

Happy hunting! :)

reviewText:
People who think this game is extremely buggy and it doesn't give me that connection terminated error. It works really well on my computer and yes it does have it glitches but not like the ones people put in their reviews. I think the game is actually cool. I know people are going to be like this is the buggiest game ever made and its more like counter strike nexon: connection terminated and other crap they will say, but for me, this game is actually fun to play. And yes I will be playing this some.
Pros:
1. it works for me
2. it works for me
3. no connection terminated for me
4. runs well

Cons:
1. Doesn't really feel like Counter Strike, but its still fun.
2. The resolution is a little off.
3. You can craft guns, but they only last about a day or a month, and you only have a limited amount of blueprints and craft items.

My rating for this game 8/10 Worth playing.

reviewText:
It reminds me of a mix between Gunz 2 itemization(<<I dislike this), and Left 4 Dead. With some counter-strike like maps and game modes. I wont lie I always have and always will dislike the idea of hourly or daily limited items. Gameplay of survival game mode I thought was unique because it got harder as the round progressed, and as the rounds progressed. Crafting I am sort of neutral on it depends on how it is setup. It mostly depends on if its going to be open market through steam. If it is going to consist meerly on how it is setup right now I dont like it. Graphics for a beta for what the game describes it to be, it is what it is a Free 2 play, with original counter strike play and feel.

Basically I think there are many things they can expand upon, and I think they are on a good start. I think if they progress the customization, the crafting, and have a open market through steam market. This game could become a good base for a mmofps. Maybe have a Item/skin involvement with CS-GO.

I am recommending this game not for what it is right now, but what I think it could turn into.

reviewText:
I'm going to throw out the minor issue I have first before I start rambling about how fun the game is.

-First Time Setup: It runs every time I launch the game.  Only takes 2-3 minutes, so I'm not going to complain too much about it.  It's just a thing that happens.

Ok, on to the good.

CSN:Z has great gameplay modes, more weapons than I know what to do with, and a nice selection of enemies to face in the Zombie modes.  Zombie shelter quickly became my favorite mode.  This is absolutely a mode to bring your friends into because it quickly becomes unforgiving without coordination.  It feels like a more compact, direct version of a lot of the survival games already out.  A little bit of Minecraft for the structure building, and Rust/DayZ/7D2D for the supply hunting and zombie splattering.

A lot of people might be turned away when they see that Nexon made this, and I might have had a second guess here or there, but after playing the game you can see that they got it right this time.  I recommend this game to anyone and everyone.  Clear your schedule, you're going to be playing for a long time.

reviewText: It's free and that's all there really is to the good points of this game.\nThis is just a reiteration of a ripoff. The reiteration is that this game obviously uses the CS 1.6 engine. If you have ever played Cross Fire which is hugely popular (I don't like that either), then you know what I am talking about.\nI would not play anymore of this game but if you have kids and want to keep them cheaply entertained with the free games on Steam then let them have at it.

reviewText:
I'm going to throw out the minor issue I have first before I start rambling about how fun the game is.

-First Time Setup: It runs every time I launch the game.  Only takes 2-3 minutes, so I'm not going to complain too much about it.  It's just a thing that happens.

Ok, on to the good.

CSN:Z has great gameplay modes, more weapons than I know what to do with, and a nice selection of enemies to face in the Zombie modes.  Zombie shelter quickly became my favorite mode.  This is absolutely a mode to bring your friends into because it quickly becomes unforgiving without coordination.  It feels like a more compact, direct version of a lot of the survival games already out.  A little bit of Minecraft for the structure building, and Rust/DayZ/7D2D for the supply hunting and zombie splattering.

A lot of people might be turned away when they see that Nexon made this, and I might have had a second guess here or there, but after playing the game you can see that they got it right this time.  I recommend this game to anyone and everyone.  Clear your schedule, you're going to be playing for a long time.

reviewText:
Dear Nexon,
It is with great regret that I write to you on this day, September 24, 2014, to inform you that you can't mash Combat Arms with Counter Strike and Call of Duty: Black Ops Zombies. I also regret to inform you that I was hoping for better gameplay, but the textrues are as important to you as golf is to teenagers - minus an except few. Now, I applaud your movement towards better gaming titles; however trying to make a Counter Strike knock-off game, isn't the greatest idea.

Sincerely,
Unhappy Customer

reviewText:
I think i am giving this game more effort with this review than the game developers gave it when making it.
The resolotion is constantly stuck on 1280x1024 and cannot be increased past this.
The Server groups are North America and Oceania (One Server with ping of 250 seen as normal), Russia (CIS) Yeah they have a server for the former USSR but not for asia as general, and then europe (Russia not in Europe but Australia in NA?)
When i read Counter-Strike Nexon: Zombies, i would have expected you know them to use the engine of counterstrike global offensive, or atleast Source because its 2014? How can they even justify using the old engine of CS 1.6 when they have a partnership with Valve?
The gameplay is laggy and dry, half the games do not even run on any sort of zombie mode and overall this game seems like an effortless pile put together by an unskilled modder.

Overall this game is a waste of the bandwith it takes to download it, anyone thinking about playing this for zombies is better off just playing zombie mod servers on CSS or CS:GO.

-A bunch off people will now give me FLAK saying its in beta and theyll fix everything but most of the things i listed (just a small piece of the cake of whats wrong with this game), are not excusable by beta or alpha or as this game feels a unfinished pre alpha build.
