reviewText:
So it's Counter-strike 1.6 with 0 upgrades... this mode is classic to a flaw, not including any maps or features found in CS:Source, then on the side, it's a pay to win pve zombie game with choppy animations and so many item timers that you'll be rolling your eyes all the way to the uninstall button.

The greatest flaw in the first person shooter/MMO market, in my opinion, is the reliance on item timers.  I don't know a single person who has bought one of these money sinks, and I don't think I'd like to know anyone that gulliable.  This stuff... this product you're selling us is already nonexistant... the least you can do is make the items permanent.

Do you sheep really think this is a revolutionary new system???  Do you somehow have so many delusions present in your life that you have lost sight of what people really want out of a game?????  Answer these questions and I'll consider playing again.

reviewText: This game. Let me start off by saying I have never reviewed a game before but feel I should in this case.  I was suspicious as soon as I read all the negative reviews but thought hey I'll give it a shot. I like CS, I like Zombies, I should like this too. What this game boils down to after playing a couple matches it bascally this. Spawn in with the Negev (or equivalent machine gun), completely ignore all other weapons and I mean ALL, SMGs, Shotguns, other pistols, useless. Then proceed to midlessly hold left left click and sway the mouse from side to side. Solved. Either that or get completely overun by the insane amounts of idential zombies. Thats it. It is a very boring, repeditive game and thats all is all. I fell that maybe if this game has more modern elements (graphics, gore system, decent models etc) this game could be more fun but as is the game runs off a decade old system (CS:CZ) and it really shows. I know its free and all but it seriouslly doesn't even warrent the Download space to get it.\n\nTL;DR Not a big download and its free but it really isnt worth your time.

reviewText:
Played 25 mins of it.

Joined a random zombie game. Was boring as hell.

In this zombie match, me and various ( about 9 other ) Counter Terrorists were constantly attacked by zombies and had to keep moving through streets. It sounds fun, but is awful. VERY awful.

For the whole experience, I had about 7 machine guns blazing in my ear as well as Fire in the hole" going off every 2 seconds.

The gameplay was bad too. What happened was
date: we had to move through streets. But
hoursPlayed: we had to stop and clear a barricade. These barricades had about 30
voteText: 000 health each. What you had to do was get about 8 people shooting down the barricade and the other 2 people shooting zombies.\n\nThe zombies were really easy to kill. They had low HP
helpfulPercent: and each time they attacked they dealt 1-2 damage to you. What's worse
votesHelpful: is every few zombie kills
votesTotal: you would get a level. These levels seemed to increase your max HP pool by about 5 per level. While it sounds reasonable
votesFunny: it was easy. For the first 10 levels

reviewText:
This is a very unique experience and totally changes the dynamics of counter strike. The PvE was somewhat dry in my opinion, and resembled Sven: Co-Op in that you essentially plow your way alongside other players through a linear map fighting back wave after wave after wave of enemy and completing certain tasks (usually blowing up a barrier that has 30,000 health) to get to the next area. There are buy zones interspersed for you to load up on ammo or switch out guns and it usually culminates in a big boss fight. It's kind of droll and there's not much of a challenge.

WHERE THIS REAAAALLLY ****REAAAAAAAAAAAALLLY**** shines however is the PvP mode where some people are zombies and some CTs each round (randomly selected).

Each zombie type has special powers, like an iron maiden it can slam down to stun enemies and hide behind, or a hoard of bats that grabs the human you aim it at and drags him toward you. The humans (CTs) have a slew of all the classic CS guns and some extras, with a much higher ammo capacity.

This mode can be SUPER intense as you spawn throughout familiar classic CS maps and try to get to high ground with other humans, since one hit from a zombie and you become one and join the hunt. Zombies have thousands of health points, but are slowed down by being hit so a group of humans can often protect themselves or give another a chance to excape, but once the guy next to you takes a scratch he'll kill you.

Playing with just a couple people is really cool too depending on the map... it becomes more like hide and seek and can be VERY intense. I played with 2 others on the classic estate map and I kept jumping as I was attacked out of nowhere, since the maps are darkened to create a tense ambience.

This mode makes it SO worth the download and since it is  free game, you've GOT to try it out... I was hooked after a couple rounds.

Happy hunting! :)

reviewText: Not sure why some people give this game a bit of hate.  Honestly, I think this game is another fantastic addition to the franchise.  The multiplayer modes and maps take us all the way back to CS 1.6, the good ole days!! But the most remarkable part of this game is easily the zombies!  In this game, they take an old idea (zombies) and add so many new modes and ways to play that it becomes utterly addicting.  There are a few bugs out there, but this game isn't pay to win at all, and the gameplay is not only classic, but fantastic!  With some patching and more work, I would go as far to say this would be the Free to Play Game of the Year.  97/100

reviewText:
Oh god, where do I start with this one.

The frame rate cap in this game is determined by your monitors refresh rate. (60Hz monitors capped at 30FPS) The game might support higher resolutions, and works fine in terms of launching the game and getting into a match. The main menu in this game is actually restricted to 1024*768 the last time I checked. There are limited video settings, but I didn't expect much since it is a GoldSrc game.

You cannot mod this game, instead it opts for you to use it's cash shop. The problem is with the cash shop is that it isn't just weapon skins and player models, it's also expensive weapon rentals. You can rent overpowered weapons by buying them, or using blueprints. Nexon tries to downplay this by giving you a whole bunch at the beginning and a little as you play the game, but once your joyride is over and you've had your fun with all those weapons, it's gonna take some time to get blueprints again. (Summed up? It's PAY TO WIN)

Some call it a free to play Counter-Strike 1.6 for it's Classic mode (Bomb Defusal/Hostage Rescue). Thing is, those cash shop weapon rentals I talked about earlier really throw the entire thing off. There is literally a grenade launcher you can get that can kill people in one good hit, plus splash damage.

Now, Zombies. The Zombie mode is pretty much the same thing as the one's you find in Counter-Strike 1.6. The models might be a higher resolution, but there's nothing too different. There's also a Basic gamemode, which is for newcomers to the Counter-Strike series in general, but it doesn't help as it adds hitmarkers and a lot of other things you'd only expect in Call of Duty.

In conclusion, just get Counter-Strike 1.6. It's more optimized and plays better than this.

Some call it a free to play Counter-Strike 1.6 for it's Classic mode (Bomb Defusal/Hostage Rescue). Thing is, those cash shop weapon rentals I talked about earlier really throw the entire thing off. There is literally a grenade launcher you can get that can kill people in one good hit, plus splash damage.

Now, Zombies. The Zombie mode is pretty much the same thing as the one's you find in Counter-Strike 1.6. The models might be a higher resolution, but there's nothing too different. There's also a Basic gamemode, which is for newcomers to the Counter-Strike series in general, but it doesn't help as it adds hitmarkers and a lot of other things you'd only expect in Call of Duty.

In conclusion, just get Counter-Strike 1.6. It's more optimized and plays better than this.

reviewText: Not sure why some people give this game a bit of hate.  Honestly, I think this game is another fantastic addition to the franchise.  The multiplayer modes and maps take us all the way back to CS 1.6, the good ole days!! But the most remarkable part of this game is easily the zombies!  In this game, they take an old idea (zombies) and add so many new modes and ways to play that it becomes utterly addicting.  There are a few bugs out there, but this game isn't pay to win at all, and the gameplay is not only classic, but fantastic!  With some patching and more work, I would go as far to say this would be the Free to Play Game of the Year.  97/100

reviewText:
Well, now that i have wasted an hour of my life playing this game to give a proper review, I will write my review.  PLEASE NOTE: This is a beta review, my complaints could change, but I don't see that happening since this is Nexon we are talking about.  Yes I am aware that this is in beta testing right now, but that is why I reviewing it, to help Nexon (if they choose to do so) fix their game.  ALSO NOTE:  I love Counter-Strike, all of them.  So this negative review is not based on my liking of CS.  Now, on to the review.


For starters, this game is Pay to Win up the booty, which is just not fine for any type of CS title, even if it is created by a different company.  Every weapon you get dissapears after so long, so have fun spending your time on a weapon that will last half as long.

Second is Sounds, and good lordy, are the sounds hilariously bad.  I actually had played this with my friend so I didnt experience the pain by myself.  While we were playing

commentsCount: which is just CTs against the Ts

column17: (depending on what game type you are on

column19: which is way too much to kill a single zombie
column20: as opposed to the zombies' one-hit kill with the secondary melee.  Not exactly fair.  As far as graphics
column21: I don't ever honestly care about graphics
column22: so long as they aren't painful to look at
column24: I found many textures that were just plain ugly and painful to look at in this game.  I love classic graphics

column37: they did everything wrong with the concept of CS with zombies in my opinion.\n\nMy final verdict would be a 3/10
